description:
Taco Bell Cantina for the win! I have been to this location twice and I've had great experiences both times. I have still yet to take advantage of the alcoholic beverages on the menu, but my friends have ordered beer and thought it was a good value. The food was good too! I always order the same 3 things, but I liked that they had unique menu items here, and shareable platters. Even when the restaurant is busy your food comes out pretty quickly and you can watch them make it if you'd like as there is a glass window in front of their stations.

The restaurant is located near AT&T Park, so it's downtown and on your way to the Pier (if that's where you're heading). I was disappointed that it wasn't larger - taking advantage of its location and potentially being 'a place to go' before a baseball game or event. I really think they could be bigger if they themselves were bigger spatially. They have a few bathrooms that require a code and they were clean enough.
author: Bri T.

description:
I usually don't review taco bells but I felt like I had to give this one a review just because of how disorganized it is. This is one of the busiest taco bells I've ever visited. It's one of those "Taco Bell Cantinas" so the interior is a bit more upscale than a typical Taco Bell. 

However, it gets super crowded during lunch from all the customers who work nearby. As a result, the inside is really messy and unkempt. The kitchen area where they assemble the food is a complete mess with lettuce and taco seasoning everywhere. The sauce packet area is usually empty and the floors are littered with food/trash.

Try to avoid, or at least don't come during lunch.
author: Michelle T.

description:
Came to this Taco Bell twice this week at 7:30 AM and both times it was closed when it is opens at 7AM. I can see the workers inside right now making food for themselves instead of helping out a customer in need. They have definitely lost our business!!!!!!!!

EDITED ****
Changed my 1 star to 3 star bc I waited and they opened and the food still dank
author: Mckenna S.

description: What the hell? That's all I have to say about this location. They don't have any hot sauces, lettuce, drinks, and tomatoes. How do you run out of that stuff?? Just close shop then. When I ordered my Taco Supremes it came out with just meat and cheese. Of course I should have checked the order but I really didn't think it was that hard to make considering they have to do this all day long. I'll never go back to this place and hope the workers get fired for serving such trash of a package.
author: Ted Y.

description:
Woof. 

I was dragged here by a buddy of mine who loves Taco Bell and had never been to a "cantina" concept before. Despite his enthusiasm, I was reluctant to give it a go. Unfortunately, I did. 

I figured that if I was going to eat there, I might as well go all out and try one of their new "concept" foods. That said, I ordered some chicken shelled taco thing and it might have been one of the worst displays of American ingenuity I've ever seen. I took one bite and that was enough for me. I mean, who in their right mind would have thought of something like that? It was terrible. 

On top of the poor food, the service team was unenthusiastic, rude and slow. I mean, I can't blame them but, it's still a job. 

Hard pass.
author: Benjamin F.

description: Placed an online order and showed up at the window to find the employee leaning against the counter snacking on food from the trays in the kitchen and using his cell phone. Then he went into the lobby and sat down while on his phone. He finally came outside and I asked him about my order. He commented that whatever order I placed, he didn't have any more food available "no tortillas or taco shells." I asked how I was going to get a refund and he said that wasn't his problem and I should contact my bank. Then he said "customers like you think we have access to mobile orders and we don't" and then he said "go to Hell" and slammed the door.
author: Brandon N.

description:
Avoid this place if you can...

I thought I was picking up a quick snack...sooo wrong!! Couldn't be more wrong if I tried!!!  35 mi wait. WTF?!  Understaffed and super slow...
Avoid this place at all costs! 
Worst Taco Bell ever...
author: Michael C.

description:
Stopped by for lunch on Thursday. The line looks long but the wait wasn't more than 10 minutes. And the menu is constantly moving so you need that time to figure out what you're gonna order anyway. 

The seating area doesn't have that many tables, and the floor was wet so it was kind of gross. But I already planned on eating at home so doesn't pertain to this review. 

I got a combo box, it was so much food for $6. Comes with a medium drink and it was HUGE. I felt like big head from Silicon Valley lol.
author: RachEl L.

description:
Anyone who knows me knows that I love Taco Bell (maybe a little too much). I've been eating it religiously since I was a kid, so this was super exciting: my first time at a Taco Bell Cantina! It felt like Christmas had come early, but sadly, it was underwhelming. Maybe that's why they serve alcohol... to make you think otherwise.

Not many tables and decently crowded at 9 pm. The kitchen is on display behind glass (Idk how much an open kitchen is really doing for this place). There's a screen showing who's waiting/completed orders; I noticed a lot of Postmates. It did feel a little grimey, combined with some sketchy characters. 

Really, the only issue is just that THIS TACO BELL IS SO SLOW. There's a Taco Bell right next to my house I frequently go to. The max amount of time I usually wait for my order is like five minutes. Now, I realize that this location may be more high traffic, but it's still crazy to wait 20 minutes for my single order of nachos to come out (this is fast food, y'all). They also messed up my friend's order (two mini chicken quesadillas) -- gave her beef instead of chicken. So she had to wait another crazy period of time for them to fix it. Other friend's spicy tostada looked like someone chewed it up first, so presentation wasn't great.

At the end of the day, though, I enjoyed how my nachos tasted: up to par with typical Taco Bell quality. I'd probably only come back to try the experience of having alcohol at a Taco Bell. Oh, and they offer free WiFi, so it's definitely a great study spot ;)
author: Anthony T.

description: I dont give 2 stars lightly. This is a taco bell, while I dotn indulge often it is not worth it when it gets dark. security is garbage even when here. daylight just normal taco bell but still some issues, overall the lack of control and safety is ridiculous. Do not come at night if you cant handle grotesque situations.
author: Chris K.

description:
A decent Taco Bell, as far as fast food in SF goes. Its cool because they have a screen showing the queue of orders so you know how long it'll take, and they also have drinks on tap.
Pretty busy late at night so expect a bit of a wait.
author: Kelsi N.

description:
One star for good location. Zero stars for everything else.

The cashier taking the order was super slow, and frankly just didn't care about his job.

While I was waiting for my food, there are a lot of people just bumming around. Some homeless, some not. But it definitely smelled like homeless in there.

Then the people preparing the food are unbelievably inefficient. Except for maybe the guy who does the final wrapping and calls up our order number. But there was a middle line guy and he just moved things from one side to the other. He took his sweet time putting lettuce in the taco. Then cheese. I think the girl next to him was impatient bc she even put cheese in the taco he was preparing.

Does management not care about or measure efficiency? I haven't gone to this Taco Bell in almost a year, and I probably will boycott for another year at least until management cleans up the operations.
author: Cal C.

description: I like this place and they are quick. But be careful from one of the employees name "Emmanuel P" Chubby big white/hispanic doude who has really bad and horrible attitude and makes the food extremely wrong with no hi or thank you. Taco bell management should look into this guy. I work in tech and i am always here but he is horrible.
author: Ameer S.

description:
This Taco Bell Cantina location is extremely inconsistent, which is why I am giving 2 stars. Ever since it opened, I visit this location at least 3 times a month for my almost weekly fix. 

Because le bf and I live so close, we normally order via the app and as soon as we place our order, le bf charges out the door so that he can ensure he gets me my tacos before the shell of my crunchy tacos gets all soft and gross. That normally ensures that we don't have to wait in line for our order. And I can attest to some of the reviews where they say the cashier is slow or the line is super long. By ordering via the app, you can skip all of that.

We get our orders usually to go. But if you dine in, be warned. Because of the location and the high foot traffic, you might sit next to some pretty shady characters and/or sit at tables that are still left dirty from the previous occupant. And because this Taco Bell seems to always be short staffed, you will have to bust your own table, if there are napkins in the dispensers. If there aren't any napkins/plastic utensils/straws/lids, good luck getting the attention of the staff behind the counter. 

When you get your order, you will want to double check that you have everything that you ordered. There are many times when they forgot to put in the chips and cheese that I ordered. And the portions can also vary widely visit to visit. For example, something I get a mini bag of chips and cheese. Other times, I get like a paper bag that is half filled with chips and then a container of cheese. 

Being a Taco Bell Cantina location, and I guess being in SF in general, this location is definitely pricer than other Taco Bell locations. So if something you order normally costs $2.50. Expect it to cost $3+ at this location. 

In general, there are a lot of things that can be improved about this location (food, customer service, consistency, cleanliness). I think that staffing this Taco Bell with more people will go a long way in improving the customer experience at this location. Sadly, I will have to put up with everything at this location because it is just so close to my place and I love getting my almost weekly fix of Taco Bell. However, after lots of trial and error, I have learned how to work around most problems at this location.
author: Carolyn Z.

description:
This Taco Bell gets 3 stars for great service: Cheerful, welcoming though looking at the sad contents in the bag, it sure didn't look like $9 worth of (fast) food.  

It was the #10 meal. Maybe they gave me someone else's lunch? I was home already, what was I gonna do? 

Two thin crunchy tacos mostly filled with iceberg lettuce and some mealy beef paste took the edge off my hunger. I didn't taste any cheese though I saw a teeny tiny dice of tomato. I poured three packets of their hot sauce on them to bump up the flavor: it was bland.

The third taco was wrapped in some soft, chewy dough over the regular hard shell taco and it was inedible. It was like chewing through a thick wad of wet paper towels. I tossed it in the bag to compost later.

That and a bucket cup of Diet Pepsi was a $9 meal. 

Really?

This Taco Bell's close proximity to AT&T park and being able to send your order via mobile and pick up at the convenient sidewalk window guarantee this location will continue to ka-ching.

I might be inspired by AT&T Park being a block away but I'll guarantee this: My third time at a Taco Bell and "Three strikes and.....you're OUT."

Swing batter!
author: Jennifer O.

description: I don't expect much from a Taco Bell but wow... this place is literally hot garbage. I've been here a few times now (it's shameful, I know) and it's always a dirty mess thats missing basic things like hot sauce, trays, and napkins. No ones nice (I get it) but they also screw up your order with at least one item. The worst Taco Bell ever- just don't go here and you can thank me later.
author: Matthew F.

description: I came here to get some food for dinner and the cashier was not able to take my order. The cashier said they were short staffed. I have never been to a food establishment where the people in this place cannot take anybody's order. No telling when they where going to take orders. What kind of business are they running. Anyways this review should be no stars at all. I put one because it won't allow me to comment without putting a star.
author: Anthony R.

description: Horrible people , they even did not give me a cup for water , very terrible service , terrible manager , fu... this place and do not go there , all stuff are disgusting......
author: Vatan X.

description:
ATTENTION: this Taco Bell serves beer!!!
It is hella nice too, 10/10, however the service is OK.. not the greatest..
author: Korina B.

description:
My first order was messed up. I walked back in and it was immediately fixed with no questions (there was someone training). I thought that was nice. 

They have free wifi. I also liked how you can see the people fixing your food through the glass. 

This location has charging stations.

Street and garage parking. Even though there was a mistake, I would still come here again for a quick fix. I like their California crunch wrap. It's a regular crunch wrap with guacamole.
author: Dorothy B.

description: This place is great and I come here often. The only concern I have is for the employees they look very unhappy. Hopefully their boss is treating them right and no abuse is going on in the work place.
author: Trisha D.

description: I may be biased here but Taco Bell is one of my favorite fast food place ever since I was a teen. Its affordable and tasty. My go to is usually the chalupas, crunch wraps, and nachos. Every so often a new item will be introduced like the naked chicken and right now the nacho fries. I grew up in Canada and Taco Bell had fries for the longest as I can remember and still do. Taco bell here release the nacho fries a few months back and then took it away but right now it's back for limited time only again. I really hope they decide to keep it. It's seasoned well and the nacho sauce is yummy to dunk in. Besides the food, this location is near the AT&T Ball park so on game days you can be in a long line to order. They also serve beer and open till midnight on weekends. They have an order screen with your name to see when your order is ready. Tip: download the taco bell app and order for pick up. Sometimes there's coupons like 25% off your first order.
author: Vinkin Ken T.

description:
Ive eaten here before. There was nothing wrong, and love the ambience of this place.

Today everything went wrong. Their pos system was down so they couldnt see the order, they said directly to me they had no change at all, told me they couldnt substitute a side taco with nachos, and above all, after I ate their burrito while at work, i vomited violently. Because of this, I easily was fatigued more then usual.

I never think highly of taco bell, because their food is absolutely disgusting compared to baja fresh, chipotle, a seafood taco place, and real mex. It feels like im eating some paste, and not fresh food. Now today, im never ever gonna try going to the bell again. There are far better mexican places then here.

And oh they gave me a bag with food on it.

Im usually positive about food, but this was really bad.
author: Carissa F.

description: Wish I could give zero stars. Advertised as closing at 1 am and I went in at 12;45 and they refused to serve us claiming that they stop serving at 12:30. Horrible customer service.
author: Amelia B.

description:
Update: still the slowest Taco Bell on the planet. Am currently waiting 6 minutes in line to even be acknowledged and I'm first in line. (They are only taking care of 6 orders on the food line) Fast food efficiency has been mastered all over the world folks. Why can't they get it right at the Taco Bell near the San Francisco Giants stadium??? The real question is, why hasn't this zombie staff been replaced by a touch screen and robots? They could easily make more money by fulfilling more orders and replacing slow workers who fumble around on the line. Perfect testing site for fast food robots in my opinion. 

Slowest Taco Bell over ever been to in my life. Everyone I encountered acted like it was their first day and they'd rather be on social media trolling world star hip hop videos. They didn't even have straws. (Only had coffee straws)

Suggestion: hire people that will actually work when they come to their job
author: Mike G.

description:
This is one of those special Cantina locations for Taco Bell, which means they serve beer and some special menu items, but for the most part are just another Taco Bell.

Pricing is affordable for being in San Francisco, but the quality and taste is just as crappy as any other fast food location.
author: Tyler T.

description:
This Taco Bell is a joke.  They charge at least 5 times more than any other Taco Bell in the country.  Why?  I have no idea.  There is no place to sit so all of it is take out.  And they charge more for what purpose?  I have no idea.  Why would I give you $5 for a taco instead of less than a dollar?  I won't.  I would never give this place my money because they rip people off.  

Shame on you Taco Bell.
author: KT T.

description:
I write this review to you, the reader as I sit here and eat my meal.

As far as Taco Bell restaurants go, the food is on par with any other Taco Bell.

The thing that stands out is the alcohol being served. This is a Taco Bell Cantina. Various beers on tap and icey-type beverages (ie margaritas, daquries, etc,). For $8 you can have one too!

So why a three star review when there's so much awesomeness going on?

1.) While the majority of the staff is friendly, there is a real lack of professionalism going on here. One young lady was walking behind the counter and flipping off one of her coworkers. Both middle fingers held high. Guess she needed the extra emphasis.

2.) No napkins. I asked. Not a single napkin in the entire restaurant. Seriously? Who's in charge of asset management? Better question, especially after the double finger flip, _IS_ there an actual management staff at this location?

3.) No change. Yeah,change was due but the register was out. No problem. Run to the back and get what you need. When I asked about my change, I was told, "I owe you about a dollar." About a dollar? Math skills not required to work here I guess. I was given a dollar. I didn't check. Didn't care at this point.

4.) There is trash everywhere. I know it's Taco Bell, but come on, bust some tables and empty the overflowing trash bins.

5.) Napkins aren't the only thing not fully stocked. Forks and knives, etc. 

6.) I've been to this location several times. It's typically one of the slowest fast-food restaurants around, especially considering its location near AT&T Park. If you're here around lunch, don't be in a hurry.

7.) I didn't see one today, but many times, homeless are camped out in the back.

The DMV style displays announcing order status are a nice touch. I love knowing the names of all the other patrons in the restaurant. Should I want to strike up a conversation with a stranger, knowing their name in advance saves time on introductions!

Despite the negative aspects, I'll be back. It's Taco Bell after all!
author: Caine H.

description: This Taco Bell serves draft beer!! If you order one have your camera ready to record and post your pour because I was mesmerized by my pour lol and regret not recording it for yelp
author: Diana H.

description:
Howdy, Management (and other interested Yelp folks):

Around 11am today, your POS system was down. Not a huge deal, but the staff definitely did not handle with tact. 

I believe I came in as soon as this happened. (There was already a hand-written sign stating most of the produce was out of stock). I did not overhear the full conversation between the person ahead of me in line..just the employee saying something along the lines of: 'I'm going on my break, sorry'. That cashier then proceeded to make their own food and go elsewhere. So did another employee.  The counter was left unattended for about 5mins while the staff making existing orders kept at it (good on them for not leaving other customers SOL). 

Someone eventually came around to tell us 'our computers aren't working and we can't make food'. No ETA on a fix or further explanation. The person at the front of the line asked for drinks on the house (good call--and that said, why were you out of freezes [again] and s/m sized cups? What's up with the inventory at this heavy-traffic area next to the stadium?). Really disappointing, even if it's silly to say for fast food. 

I had cash, and the food on the line was only going to get old as time went on. Sure, business wasn't crazy at the moment... But imagine if it had been. Folks might have caused a big scene, especially for those of us who often think outside the bun. (Represent). 

This experience was a let down. No cervesa... Zero manners. Total disappointment. Leaving 2stars because this location hasn't always been sucky, but this experience was the worst I've probably had any time I've gone to a Taco Bell. (No shame, it's tasty.)

Please work on ensuring your computers don't kick the bucket and that staff have better customer service skills in the future. Thanks. Live más. ...and happy Father's Day.
author: Jona N.

description: It's a great and impressive location. However, they have unreasonable practices. I ordered late night delivery and they shut that down at 1030pm, despite being open til 1am. The manager actually called me after 1 hr after my order to explain this to me. I mentioned that he should just work it out with the delivery services. I don't understand why they can't accept these orders. Don't they make the same amount?
author: Young Y.

description: This is not your standard Taco Bell location, they are trying something new and I like it. Similar food fare but the decor is nicer, serves alcohol and has big screen TVs. I guess this is their response to Chipotle and credit to them for trying something new. A food upgrade to go along with this overhaul will go a long way.
author: Sunil R.

description:
Taco Bell is great for a late night craving and the cantina is an awesome concept. The store is ultra modern with a fresh design on your typical Taco Bell. But the service here is awful
. These guys are always understaffed half the time are out of what your looking for and even mess up orders on a bean and cheese burrito...... bro it's literally two ingredients! Who ever is owning and opporating this store is doing a disservice to the Taco Bell Corp by not properly staffing and having enough food/supplies to operate a business on a daily regime. Have fun waiting an hour for tacos
author: Kristen P.

description:
***Warning for Taco Bell app users***

This location will accept your app order even if they don't have the items in stock. Only upon receiving the notification that your order is ready for pick up and showing up at the restaurant to pick up said order will you be informed that not only do they not have the items in stock but that they also have no idea how to refund you for your order.
author: Codsworth S.

description:
The service here was horrible. The two ladies working the cash register were fighting while I was trying to order, then once they said my order was ready they told me they don't have what I ordered!
However, manager was very helpful!
author: Kelsey M.

description:
I was at a Halloween party and luckily for me, they ordered crunchy tacos from Taco Bell! They arrived on Saturday, October 28th a little before 10pm.

One of my girlfriends took care of this part of our dinner / party snack. I believe she placed an order online for something like 100 tacos. (I played around with the online ordering and I think you have to place two orders of 50 as that's the max per pick up order. This sounds right as I think that's what my gf mentioned when we spoke about it.) Another friend went ahead and picked up the tacos to bring to the party. I adore Taco Bell's crunchy tacos, so I was super happy when they arrived! Although, the tacos weren't as filled as I remember. Maybe cuz it was such a big order?

One of the better locations as they offer online ordering. Makes grabbing food so much easier!
author: Elena N.

description:
I hate this place.
Long ass wait.
The employees are hella lazy.
No seasoned beef??? For real???
No move slower please...no one wants their food now.
Yea just sit in the back booth and eat and not do anything its fine.
You have a whole line of people who came just to wait.
This review is long enough...thanks.
author: Starr B.

description:
I don't expect much from Taco Bell. I really don't. However, when 11/12 items ordered are incorrect and the "Doritos cheesy Gordita crunch" you ordered is A. Not a Doritos cheesy Gordita crunch and B. Looks like this, it's pretty infuriating. 

The only reason this pathetic excuse for a taco made it to my desk is because I ordered through Postmates but the quality of the food and the erroneous items were very clearly the fault of the vendor.
author: Aria L.

description:
Was hoping it would be like Vegas but it wasn't.

But the reason I gave one star was the lady taking orders a girl with dark curly hair got a call on an iPhone and kept saying to ashley who was making the food "ashley you have to take this call"

I placed my order and then went to watch ashley make my food. She was still on the phone and once the call was done....she kept the same gloves on. GROSS!! State law requires gloves to be changed if you touch your face, hair, trash, it may not say iPhone but it came out of the girls butt pocket who was taking orders so who knows where that phone and jeans have been. Once call was done she should have changed her plastic gloves. A box of 100 cost what $5?
author: Ashley T.

description:
Tip #1: Be prepared to wait. This Taco Bell is slow. 
Tip #2: Don't try to order ahead- I have tried twice and it has messed up somehow both times so I end up having to wait anyway. 

On the upside, it's a convenient location on the way to or from a baseball game and since there are not many in the city, I am just glad it exists.
author: Kate P.

description: Very quick to get the food out, but every time I have ever gone in, there's someone talking on their mobile phone at the register. Incredibly rude and annoying that I have to wait for them to say "hold on" to the person on the other end.
author: Aaron C.

description: The worst Taco Bell I've ever been to.  I like Taco Bell food, but not at this place. They were out of lettuce, taco sauce, soda , etc.  Homeless people inside and outside   So gross
author: Sharon H.

description:
Ok before I start I know this is Taco Bell fast food so I get what I paid for.   Upon entering the restaurant I stood looking at the menu and deciding on what I wanted to order. I couldn't help but notice how dirty this restaurant was. There was garbage on the floors, dirty tables, the condiment area was filthy as was the fountain drink area. 

Put the cleanliness aside I ordered my food.  The order taker seemed like she was more interested in looking at her phone rather than taking my order.  I ordered the Taco Salad (safe bet and somewhat healthy ). 

The reason for the 2 stars not so much the food as it's typical Taco Bell but the cleanliness of the restaurant and the staff.  The guy preparing the orders (they are behind a glass wall in plain view of all the customers) was on his phone the entire time while preparing everyone's food. There was even a gentleman standing on the side because they got their order wrong and he was ignored 5 Times (I was counting). 

Customer service and cleanliness is not their strong points here. But again this is fast food Taco Bell go figure.
author: Brandon K.

description:
Me: Id like a the 3 taco combo please
Cashier: We are out of beef, only chicken left
Me: ok, that's fine
Cashier: that's an extra $2
Me: what? You're out.
Cashier: we are also out of small cups too, so I have to charge you another $2.50 extra for a medium
Me: what??? I have to pay an extra $5 for things I don't have a choice in?
Cashier: yea 

I walked out.
author: Katherine W.

description: The service was okay. The cashier seemed like he hated his life at first but I was extra friendly and managed to get him to crack a smile. The food was good. My appetite was interrupted by this lovely ball of hair right behind me, though.
author: Clarissa E.

description: Don't come here if you are in a rush...4 employees to run a little Taco Bell in San Francisco is not enough staff...They make the food right there in front of you but they took 15 minutes to make three items for me. Two people in charge of making the food, one cashier and one girl just walking back-and-forth doing absolutely nothing...The food was delicious don't get me wrong for my first time trying breakfast items off the menu so I wasn't too worried about the food but the wait time sucked.
author: Addison M.

description: So, this was our first time at the cantina. It felt that no one had any idea they were working today. Two people were fighting at the register. We ordered a twisted freeze and they told us they did not serve any alcohol... the manager and another worker were working so hard to save the place and I felt for them. It's really hard to work with people who act like they don't care. Go somewhere else if you want Taco Bell.
author: Laura C.

description:
Such bad service at fancy looking place.
After waiting in line for 20 mins (8 people ).  They said it will be 20 mins wait for the food because of large order.  I ask for just the nacho fries that they already have them ready, she reply it will be still 20 mins wait.  
The layout was bad, the menu is in the middle but counter is at the left inside corner, people have to walk back and fort for the order.  The service is all glass that we could see how slow people are just packing the food.
author: Victor L.

description: Came here expecting an above average Taco Bell experience. What we got was the worst taco experience I've ever had. Service wasn't good but whatever. It costs more than other Taco Bell's. There was no ice and the soda was lukewarm but we were told about this when we ordered drinks and the bathrooms were out order..
author: Sean  V.

description:
You can get the Fill-Up box for $5.99 ($6.50 after tax) or pay $$$ for food at AT&T Park. Up to you. This is an awesome location and they did a great job with this Cantina. Fast and friendly service. They do compost & recycling which is a plus.

The haters will be haters and these reviewers are too boujee to give a Taco Bell 5 stars despite the fact that they are the same people who rate every In n Out 5 stars. You know I'm right.
author: Joshua F.

description: Waiting exceeds 15 mins in this place for a small order. Half the items were not available on a Friday night - no chicken items, no sides. Location is on 3rd Street in the city, so parking is a pain.
author: Srinivas R.

description:
I know taco bell head quarter could care less about this review but I need you all to know how your employee acted to one of your customer today on 9/28/18. At 5:48 pm.
I went to your store to order food your employees one of them the cashier Noelia M. Was super rude to me and was giving me attitude the minute I walk up to order. I also work in customer service and I know that sometimes customers can be asshole, but there should be no reason for she to acted that way toward me. She roll her eyes at me and I can get that she is very annoyed when I started my orders. Yes I'm on a food run for people and no I have no control on what others want to order. Then during the middle of the orders she called her manager on duty over and rolled her eyes again an walk off. The manager at that time takes over and I can already feel that they want me to get the hell out of the store t by e minute I pay they handed me my food instantly but it wasn't respectful or courteous. It was as if they are shooing a fly out. That was very disrespectful of all the employees at that time. I want HQ to  Contact me about this issues because it was unacceptable of what has happen here. My email is lilyto187@gmail.com
author: Lily N.

description: There are too few employees here and the food takes forever.  It's kinda dirty and they don't have enough staff.  Hire more people please!  Also the layout is weird so it doesn't sway that many people.  Great location and needs work.
author: Chris L.

description: Hellllllaaaaaa slow. But they have beer now! And a pretty extensive menu. Gets super crowded before and after Giants games.
author: Cliff H.

description:
I'm almost embarrassed to admit that I came here (it's literally been a decade since I last stepped foot in a Taco Bell). 

But I'll suppress my inner bourgeois ego and admit that this place is a lot nicer than the name suggests, and rightfully so - it's a flagship restaurant. If I had to be honest, the food is pretty tasty and the restaurant is quite nice.
author: Jeremy C.

description: 5 stars for awesome customer service. I stopped in to grab a soda in the middle of the lunch hour rush. It took a few minutes for the woman working behind the counter to take my order and when I told her I just wanted to purchase a drink, she gave me a cup for free because of my wait. Super kind - I'll definitely come back to this Taco Bell!
author: Katie C.

description: I inadvertently experienced the post-giants game desolation of a poor, unsuspecting Taco Bell, so that's why it gets a charitable two stars. They ran out of beef. They ran out of chicken. They ran out of ice. They ran out of soap in the bathroom. They did have an abundance of lethargic (probably tired/dazed) workers and a bumper crop of homeless people milling around, though. I was there at like 8PM so I have no clue what they planned on doing in the many hours remaining until close. At least they didn't run out of cool ranch shells or beer.
author: Jeff F.

description:
This is the worst run Taco Bell I've ever been to. They are completely incompetent. They never have any sauces stocked. They constantly get our orders wrong and have terrible customer service. 

Never coming again.
author: Cora H.

description:
Always understaffed. I've been at his location at huge rushes and have seen 1-2 employees running between register and food prep. 

As such, service is pretty slow. The workers seem particularly fed up with job as they always look pis-ed you are there. 

One employee in particular started fighting with a customer at the register,screaming "Hit me, hit me. Free hit. Come on"

As for food. It's Taco Bell. No better or worse than what you're used to. It's a bit nice they have a chipotle-like layout where you watch them make your food, though.
author: Josh M.

description:
At the end of the day, Taco Bell is a reliable and convenient spot when you can't find anything else, when it's late, and when you want something that isn't too hard on your wallet. 

I came here after a game at AT&T, and while it was crowded, the cashiers were efficient with taking orders. On the flip side, after ordering it took nearly 30 minutes to actually get our food, which was tough on a weekday because we had to be up early for work the next day. 

This is probably a better choice when it's less crowded - but in the city I doubt you'd find a time when anything isn't crowded. If you plan to eat here after a Giants game, be aware that it may take longer than anticipated - especially if you plan on catching MUNI or BART afterwards.
author: Mili P.

description:
Attn: Store Managers
Better training overall for your staff in general to handle the register and cashiering duties.  Staff member did not know how to handle a situation without change?  Really?  He didn't seem inclined to make a request for change either.  Almost walked away with free food too because he didn't realize we hadn't paid yet.  Didn't seem like he cared either way.
author: Pat L.

description:
Super slow service, filthy, filled with homeless beggars either inside or outside, often digging through the trash and the workers don't seem to care to do anything about it. 

Other than that, it's a normal Taco Bell and you get what you expect
author: Dixiee N.

description: This Taco Bell is never open in the morning. The website sat 7 and the sign says 8 but it 8:12 am and it's still not open. I have to start work and all I want is my breakfast crunch wrap
author: Rosanna G.

description: Stopped by today because I'd never experienced a Taco Bell "Cantina". The "Cantina" concept is really just your average Taco Bell with the added benefit of a few beers, nothing more nothing less. Trash greets you right at the front door and is strewn all throughout the joint--tables, fountain, bathroom--nothing is spared from the shear amount of wrappers, napkins, and beverage containers. Service is also equally trash.
author: Eva L.

description:
I came into this Taco Bell Cantina starry-eyed in hopes to wash down my fake Mexican food with a cold alcohol spiked baja blast freeze. However, the glimmer immediately faded when I discovered that this location actually doesn't have their liquor license after all, thus making it just another plain taco bell (with a slightly more modern vibe, I guess).

However, we were already there so my friend and I decided to order anyways. He got the chalupa box, which is probably the best deal there if you're interested in getting some sort of combo with a drink. Unfortunately, he asked for no lettuce and tomato, and every single one of his chalupas came with the two ingredients. It wasn't even busy, so it was all the more disappointing that they didn't get it right.

But on one final good note, our cashier Devonte was great. A super friendly guy that definitely made our Taco Bell experience all the better during this trip in.
author: Mars S.

description:
I never thought I'd go out of my way to rate a Taco Bell 5 stars on Yelp, but here I am.

Taco Bell Cantina on 3rd St, even without the upcoming liquor license, is amazing. The food just tastes better here, and looks better, too, almost like food from a commercial. Not sure what's in this location's secret sauce, but I hope they keep it up!
author: Yasmin S.

description:
I was never a fan of taco bell to begin with but there was a lot of hype around this taco bell "cantina" to be above and beyond the usual taco bell. More like a fancier upscale joint that served wine and beer. It sounded like a cool idea - the store front is cool and it looks clean, friendly, fancy screen menus. 

Also all my friends LOVE taco bell. At first I thought everyone was like joke liking taco bell but they all honestly crave it and love it. I wish I could be there with them in this taco bell euphoria but I just don't get it. There's so many better options. 

I ordered a  breakfast burrito to eat before work. It was so sad and flimsy and I mean I guess for the price it's like what was I expecting but still. Breakfast burritos should be big and hearty not like a sad luke warm tortilla with a tiny bit of cheese and potato. 

My friends will all think I'm crazy and say I ordered wrong but I'm probably just not the taco bell audience. Two stars mostly because it's good looking taco bell and the people were nice.
author: Veronica L.

description: Wow this place is fancy and service was nice, but hm somehow it seems they don't know the recipes for assembling the food and the wait is a bit long considering it is a fast food joint. All in all generally about what you would expect. My burrito was a little sad and lacking ingredients. I only went in because it was convenient at the time and it looked pretty cool from the outside, will I be back? Probably not.
author: Guisela L.

description: This place will never have naked egg tacos, naked chicken chips, naked chicken chalupas, so don't waste time coming for a special.
author: John B.

description:
Every once in a while you get that fast food itch that you just need to scratch. Since the McDonalds across the street was torn down, this has become my go to spot for those urges. Nothing will replace the 20 piece McNugget hole in my heart, but the naked chicken chalupa comes close. 

I have many fond memories of eating baja steak and chicken chalupas during lunch in high school. Taco Bell has upped the ante with the naked chicken chalupa and replaced the entire tortilla shell with a flattened piece of fried chicken at the same price point as a normal chalupa. Wow! Get them while they're still available. Taco Bell is also offering a drink, chips, taco, Doritos taco, and naked chicken chalupa meal for around $6. 

Overall, prices are reasonable and the food tastes like what you expect. Salty, savory goodness. Drizzle some diablo hot sauce on top and you're good to go. As far as I can tell, the menu is exactly the same as a normal Taco Bell. The decor brings the venue up to the feel of a trendier SF restaurant and I have to say it's not bad. Better than the vibe at the Carl's Jr. / Green Burrito on Market for example. 

My most recent trip was for lunch on Sunday, no line at all. Weekday lunchtime draws huge crowds so if possible, avoid unless you order ahead. It's not a place I can go to more than once a month, but I know I'll never be let down.
author: Zihao X.

description:
One of the worst and least prepared Taco Bell's I've ever visited. What a waste of space and design, because it looks great on the inside. I have a feeling that corporate thought it would be a great idea to build a special Taco Bell "Cantina" here, it failed miserably and now it has abandoned ship. 

So what am I talking about here? Came here on Sunday night, around 8pm. Considering they are opened until midnight, I thought it wasn't an outrageous time to come here.

As I scanned the menu, I noticed a hand written sign next to the cash register. It said "No Taco Sauce - No Fire, No Hot, No Mild". It didn't really register in my mind for a second. Wait a minute, you don't have any taco sauce at all? What Taco Bell has ever run out of taco sauce? I'm pretty amazed by this turn of events. However I figured we were already there, so let's make the best of it. My son said he wanted to order a burrito and taco combo. So I walked to the register and the gentlemen said "don't have it". I said "excuse me?". He said they didn't have any flour tortillas. So I asked again because I couldn't believe my ears. You can't make anything? He said yes, they didn't have any flour tortillas, and they couldn't make anything that needed tortillas. So all they could make were tacos without taco sauce. I asked it they had red sauce that they normally put into the burritos so that at least I could order some tacos and put some of that sauce in it. He said "no". So I guess there was nothing else I could do but give up and go somewhere else. I suggest you do the same.
author: Dom L.

description: Terribly slow service for being a fast food joint. Not even the new addition of alcohol will bring me back to this place for awhile. They used to be quick....
author: Neilson V.

description:
Somehow despite looking fancy, it's the actual worst Taco Bell I've ever been to. They do orders one-by-one at a rate of five minutes per order (you can opt to stand at the glass counter to have the dissatisfaction of watching them). They are always either silent or rude when taking orders. I sometimes see them take smoke breaks during times of heavy traffic. And listening to customers around me, they get a LOT of orders wrong. Today it was 4 in a row.

Only come here if you want to wait 30 minutes for a few tacos.
author: Andrew F.

description:
I came out of the gym with the need to get a taco to munch on. Sure enough, this location immediately came to mind.

Here are the items I ordered:
- grilled steak taco
- nachos (tortilla chips and cheese sauce)

Modern Taco Bell restaurant with flat screen televisions mounted to the wall. Plus, I liked how clean the entire facility is. The food is good, team members on duty were friendly and service is prompt.

If you need something to munch on right before or after a round of bowling, then Taco Bell got you covered.

Reasons for rating:
- modern facility
- clean restaurant
- friendly members
- prompt service
- good food at reasonable pricing

Overall, positive first experience here!
author: Bennett W.

description: Had our friends birthday party at the Cantina!!! Jasmine set it up and even provided a hot sauce mascot!!!!  Great way to spend a bday and Friday night!!!
author: Alec S.

description: Staff here is terrible... super slow service (30 minutes per order when the store is completely empty) with the staff blatantly using profanity and giving out food to friends for free (especially the  extremely extremely short woman)
author: Jason L.

description:
I've used the app to order food from this Taco Bell in the past.  It wasn't the best experience, but last week I thought I'd give it another chance.

The app will tell you how long it will be until your order will be ready.  For me, it was 5-8 minutes.
I showed up 10 minutes after placing my online order, & just like the last time I tried the app, my meal wasn't ready.. so I got the cup for the drink I paid for & waited patiently.  
I watched as 2 people behind the glass made other people's orders.  When it was finally my turn (well past the estimated 5-8 minutes), my name was called out.  One employee began to apologize that they didn't have something I'd ordered in stock.  He was corrected by another employee who told me it was regarding someone else's order.
As she was telling me this, I watched one of the girls who was making food, take 2 PRE MADE tacos out of the refrigerator & put it in my bag.  
When I got home, most everything in the bag was soggy. Items were wrapped haphazardly.  It looked like a bomb went off in the bag.
Eating soggy tacos is not only difficult, it makes them taste bad.

The 2 people I interacted with were friendly, hence the 2 stars.

My advice to management.....a brush up on preparation skills is imperative!!  Especially for orders that are to go.  Food that supposed to be hot & crisp, but is given to a customer soggy is wrong.  I should've driven back to get a full refund.
author: Reed S.

description:
First of all how are you going to say you open at 7am when in reality you guys don't open usually u til 830 or later?!?!? And don't bullshit me saying this only happened once....I work across the street....do u know how many times I was craving a chalupa only to find out you guys aren't even opened yet despite stating 7am start time?

Does corporate know this or are you guys also forging time cards like you forge open times?

Lastly, try hiring people that actually wanna work. Tired of people there with a ifgaf attitude. You're there to work, not fcking gossip on the phone and Shit
author: Michael C.

description: The absolute longest wait time of any Taco Bell I've ever been to. I actually walked out waiting over 20 minutes for 1 burrito.
author: Roger A.

description: We went to this talk bell last night at 12:30am after checking that it closes at 1am. And we see some folks walk out with food and 3 workers behind the counter. We walk up and the gal at the register looks at us and says the computer is broken. And they can't order any food at all. So we walk out to the street where we can see the entire input in the computer and completely behind the counter. And then another customer walks up and orders food and we see the input. So we walk back in thinking their "system" came back up. She refused us again!!! COMPLETE discrimination!!! Tall and blonde!  The minority in this city any more. "Reverse" discrimination is everywhere!!! I will never eat here ever again. The rudest gesture ever!
author: Annette B.

description: Ordered two tacos and they gave me one, so then I re ordered the taco and they forgot about my order SO I re ordered and they gave me a soft taco instead of crunchy one. A girls gotta get her Taco Bell fix on! The staff clearly gives zero f&@$"
author: Rachelle G.

description: How does a Taco Bell run out of soft shell tacos not once BUT TWICE in the course of two weeks? This is ridiculous.
author: D Andrew P.

description: The girl at the counter was very rude. I bought some food and they said they don't give you cup for water. One of the worst experiences.
author: Chabi K.

description:
Live Mas Indeed! Taco Bell, kicked up a notch. 

Nah, for real, this seems to be like a normal Taco Bell, only hipper, with a big screen tv, more items on the menu, and the possibility of beer on the horizon. Millennials can rest assured that there are fancy plastic trays for the food, wall outlets for webwork, big windows for people watching, and 'modern' minimalist wooden décor.

As far as fancy Taco Bells go, this one is elite status. I was in the city for a day trip, and my bf and I got a little too excited about visiting the trendy new Taco Bell Cantina. Located in the SoMa (of course, right?)/China Basin area, within walking distance of AT&T park, this is only the second such Taco Bell to open nationwide. 

Beer is not available yet, as of October 17th, 2015, but there is a petition to sign if you wish to help in this boozy endeavor. All I'm sayin' is that all these exciting "new" appetizer entrée items only available here would wash down real nice with a Pacifico....
author: Jenny P.

description:
This is not just your ordinary Taco Bell. Also most of the fast food restaurants are starting to modernize the concepts and structure from a plain restaurant from yester years. 

This new taco bell has a similar configuration to a taqueria. Customers get to see our food in the kitchen being prepared behind the glass window by the hard-working workers.  Also a plus that workers are wearing gloves when making our food. 

It has been a few years since I have dined at a Taco Bell restaurant. I have missed out on many of the new items served from the chain. On my debut of the new location, I ordered a combo that comprised a Steak burrito, a taco made with a Dorito-flavored hard-shell, a regular taco and a soft-drink for $6.99 + tax. I was never a big fan of Dorito-flavored tortilla chips. But I find the specialty taco a unique item and add a kick to my taco. 

As I was enjoying my dinner, I was watching the Monday Night football game. I was told the restaurant will serve beer and cocktails here once the license has been approve which not many fast food restaurant offers. And with restaurant being located within steps of the AT & T Park, this restaurant would be great to enjoy your meal and watching the San Francisco Giants play on TV. 

There have been many businesses come and gone at this corner spot. But I think this new Taco Bell has found a new home in the Mission Bay neighborhood.
author: Matt G.

description:
Taco Bell is what it is.  Fast food Mexican.   This location has a problem with staffing.  Every time I go there, during the busiest times, there were only two people working.  Two people can only do so much so fast.  Lines and a crowd of people waiting are inevitable.  This is not a place you'd want to go if you're pressed for time.  I ordered my food online and arrived 15 minutes later.  I walked in and the line was nearly out the door because the cashier had to help make the food. I waited an additional 10 minutes for my food and not one person had ordered at the register.  The poor employees were moving as fast as they could.  They need at least 3 people there and four would be ideal.

An update.  I returned and was ecstatic to see 4 people behind the counter, which leads me to this updated review. I ordered and checked in online.  I figured they'd be busy so I showed up nearly 30 minutes after I ordered.  I arrive there and they told me that I now had to check in at the register.  So now I have to wait in line just to let them know that I'm waiting for an online order which kind of defeats the whole purpose of ordering online.    Needless to say, I was pretty upset at this point.  When I finally got my order after another 10 minutes of waiting, it wasn't even right.  I was missing two tacos and had some stuff in the bag that I didn't even order, but I just wanted to get out of there.   I also ordered cinnamon twist which I was informed wasn't available at that location.  They didn't offer a refund or replacement.  They just told me and that was it, so I basically lost my money on that.  

So now I know.  Its not the lack of people, but lack of competent people at this location.
author: Milton W.

description: I started the order at the cashier by telling him that we wanted everything with bean instead of beef. Then i realized after we got our receipt that he only did the first thing in our order with bean instead of beef so I had to go back and make sure they made it with bean. We waited an hour for our food and then realized that they started calling numbers higher than ours. I went up to the counter and asked if they already called our number. They said they had and someone must have taken it. I never heard them call our number so I am not sure they ever did, but if they did they didn't call it out loud enough. Instead of saying they would make it again right away he told me I should probably just get a refund because it will take them too long to make. I just got a refund because it was not worth waiting another hour for with no guarantee that we would even get our food. I could tell that other people were getting frustrated that they were waiting so long. This is the worst fast food experience I have ever had.
author: Cady L.

description:
I've been to over 100 locations in my life and this one is exceptionally slow. They only had two people working. 1 person was taking orders and the other was preparing them. I ordered 2 potato soft tacos and it took 25 min. I only have 30 min lunch break... not worth it. 

I would say it's not the employees fault but they could definitely work faster and/or prioritize orders that are small and quick to get them out. They just seemed really slow and lethargic. This location is always busy during lunch and should be managed better. It's Taco Bell, not NASA...
author: Iyahman R.

description:
I personally consider myself to be a connoisseur of all things Taco Bell therefore I have been in a lot in my day but let me tell you this...this is the nicest Taco Bell I have ever been in. This is not just a regular Taco Bell, this is a Taco Bell Cantina. Although they aren't selling the alcohol quite yet, the staff here is really attempting to make this a dining experience. The staff was incredibly kind and constantly checking in with my friend and I. They offered to bring us water, napkins, sauce, anything our heart desired and it was awesome. I especially enjoy that there is finally something fast-food in SoMa besides McDonalds. 

I highly recommend this Taco Bell Cantina, they've got a great staff and I pretty much had the best Steak Quesarito of my life here. Hit them up. Come have a Taco Bell Dining Experience. Also, they have a pick-up window if you order from the official Taco Bell app so that's for sure something to consider.
author: Adrianna L.

description:
Upon entering the cantina, someone will greet you enthusiastically. Which was hilarious my first time here cause it freaked me out cause like uh, this is Taco Bell.

I use the app to order my food here so I can just pass by all the people in amazement and get straight to it. I am on a time limit, people!

The customer service here is like this place is owned by the warmest, happiest, trendiest grandpa and everyone who works here is one of his delightful grandchildren.

I like ordering online cause it really allows you to customize the hell out of anything and it's ready when you get there.

If you order in they give you your food on a cute little hot dog basket and then they come and clean up all your mess!

The starbursts slushies are so smooth and icy and perfect!

Don't come here if you already don't like Taco Bell. Just let us enthusiasts Live Mas.

(unrelated side note: SUCK IT JERREL!)
author: Niana D.

description: Finesse, the manager, was dismissive to multiple friends who tried to pick up the order. It was supposed be ready by 11:09am but when they arrived they said they couldn't help us or give a refund until noon. It's now 1om and I had to personally handle this. Talked to another employee after the manager told me to work it out with my bank and she walked away. She was rude, didn't even try to help, and didn't even try to look at the system to give me a refund. The other employee was kind and did his best. They were selling orders though they couldn't even make because they were on low supply. The manager was horrible, disorganized and clearly bad at handling customers.
author: Nikki F.

description: It's 10:45 p.m. Thursday April 20th 2017.  I arrived to this location and I was met at the entrance by a staff member who informed me that this location is closed because they are understaffed and running out of food. Just thought you should know.
author: David D.

description:
I frequent this Taco Bell quite a bit because it's close to my office and the cheapest choice around here. 

Look, I get that things happen and short staffing isn't avoidable at all times for whatever reason, but it would serve you well to notify the customers that there will be a wait before they can place their order. No, instead you ignore the line and don't say one word. 2 people leave during the almost 10 minutes I patiently stood in line. At one point I walk over to the glass and ask the girl if anyone was going to take our orders. Instead of the typical customer service response, I get a glare. I brush it off because this girl usually has an attitude, but still, what I asked wasn't some ridiculous request.

After waiting for a few more minutes, the same girl finally comes over to the register and I think i'm going to finally be able to order and rush back to the office. NAWL. Instead with the thickest attitude she was able to muster and says "I'm not taking any orders for 15-20 minutes. You're gonna have to come back later!!".

Uhhh..ok. I'm not going to argue with her about what she is and isn't going to do. Though telling people you won't be taking orders for 15-20 mins when the lunch rush is about to start is RIDICULOUS. What I take issue with most out of this whole situation is that no one even acknowledged the line for 10 whole minutes and when they did, it was slathered in attitude. If you indeed won't be performing a basic function of your job, communicate that to the customers in line w/o a verbalized eye roll ASAP. That way we can figure out other options in the limited about of time we have for lunch.

I'm not going to act like I won't be back to this location, but this could have been handled way better by your staff.
author: teege c.

description: I'm not sure what all the bad reviews are expecting, but this place is as good as it gets for a tbell. Lines usually aren't too long, they have never messed up my order, and the toppings are consistently evenly distributed. I refuse to go to one of the KenTacoBells that have plagued SF until now. I'm ready for more Cantina Bells!
author: Sheel M.

description: Was excited for a cravings deal! Instead got food that was poorly made. Super sloppy. We wanted to try the fries and this was what we got. Bummed there are no good Taco Bell's in the city.
author: Mark B.

description:
I can't remember the last time I ate Taco Bell sober, but we were tired of donuts so we thought we'd give it a try.  7:25 we come up to the locked door.  Sign says open at 7.  We peer in and the 20 year old RBF employee sloths over, unlocks the door and wanders off without a word.  Whatever.  They sure weren't late opening because they were busy cleaning - the place is DIRTY.  The table next to us has a dead fly on it and there is garbage on the floor in the corner.  Next, the word "cantina" is misleading and pisses me off.  Cantina means bar.  Don't give me this shit about how you will have alcohol when you get a license - you have been open over a year.  A Taco Bell with a big screen TV isn't that impressive....
The food was entirely average.  Hard to screw up bacon and eggs in a tortilla.  Price was low.  I may go back but I can't see me craving the place.
author: Ken P.

description:
This location is just downright terrible. I have had so many messed up orders here that I started to LITERALLY order a few extra items each time to make sure I get enough to eat when I inevitably throw out the mistakes. It got so bad one time the owner literally drove to my house to deliver a third-remake of a large order. 

Tonight was the real icing on the cake when I submitted an app order only to realize they had decided to close an hour early for no reason. After knocking on the door for awhile they stopped cleaning for 60 seconds - long enough to tell me "this isn't our problem sir, you're going to have to dispute the charge with your bank". 

I will be avoiding this location from now on. Given the likelihood you'll get messed up food and deal with the hassle, it's worth the money to Postmates from another Taco Bell.
author: Ryan S.

description: Customer service here is horrible. They open at 7am and i call at 9am four times. Four times and it just rings. Never ordering here again
author: Sabrina G.

description:
This all happened on 04/22/17 at night around ~8:00 PM.

They ran out of beef and only had chicken or steak.  They also ran out of Brisk lemonade + tea and ice.  Not only that, but they also got our order wrong.  We had the spicy triple double crunch wrap chicken, but they gave us steak.  I had a crunchy taco, they gave me a supreme burrito with some ultra nasty avocado and no meat, just beans.  

Yeah we had to choose steak or chicken since they ran out of beef, but in all our food there was hardly any steak - clearly skimping on that.  And it tasted kind of funny too.  Everything was just really sloppily thrown together, all the meat is just sitting at the bottom of the burrito.

Everyone was waiting for a really freaking long time.  I could tell everyone else was frustrated.  Everything just sucked tonight.
author: Kevin N.

description: This is a really nice Taco Bell. Think it was meant to be a Cantina to serve drinks and all but clearly that didn't happen. I like Taco bell when I'm super hungry and I don't have time to get a sit down meal for lunch/ dinner. ENJOY!
author: Darlene Y.

description:
A Taco Bell Cantina is different than your typical Taco Bells; as you can order online, the interior is fancier, there's TV's everywhere, but the food taste the same.  It is nice to have another option for fast food than the McDonald's across the street.  It's especially much nicer to dine here than McDonald's too.

One of the biggest difference between a regular Taco Bell compared to a Cantina one, is that they're supposed to have a liquor license and serve alcohol.  They've been opened for almost a year now and they still do not have their liquor license yet.  I'm starting to believe that they will never have the ability to serve alcohol, so this is just a fancier looking Taco Bell.

As for the food, it taste like any other Taco Bell.  The prices are pretty much the same too, but the service is pretty crappy.  The food is always made sloppy and I have gone back to the counter on more than one occasion to ask them to remake it, or add or subtract items from my order.  What do you expect from a Taco Bell?  At least the prices are still cheap, and it's nice to watch the Giants game here too.
author: Johnny W.

description:
If you like Taco Bell like me, but have always wanted to watch your it prepared and delivered at an excruciatingly slow place while behind the safety of a large glass window, this is your place. 

The food safety score of 100 is a nice touch that definitely adds to the experience.
author: Jeremy J.

description: FAST food? More like fasting for food. Every time I have been here, it has taken 20+ minutes to get my food. If I wanted a sit down restaurant, I wouldn't go to Taco Bell. One guy even brought his pizza while he waited.
author: April A.

description:
The interior is modern and fancy with exposed brick, flat-screen TVs and antique wooden stools. 

The food is the same ol' Taco Bell you know, aka does the trick if you can't bring yourself to get any other food, and will not decompose if you leave it sitting out for a week. 

The prices are at least 20-30% higher than your non-fancy Taco Bell, so you're definitely helping them pay for their exposed brick, their flat-screens, $$ rent in SoMa, and the attendant standing next to the line...as if anyone needed help ordering Taco Bell. 

Oh, and you can order through their app on your smartphone and pickup in the window, if you live right upstairs like me and want minimal contact with the constant gusty winds on Townsend Street.

They are supposed to be getting their liquor license soon and be able to serve beer, but I've been here since they opened and that has yet to show up.
author: Inga C.

description: There are 4 people in the back. 3 are standing and staring blankly. One is working slowly. I've been waiting 20 minutes and I think I've seen 4 orders go out.
author: Kiffiny W.

description: While in a prime location, this place is dirtier than the average Taco Bell and doesn't live up the the "cantina" monicker. Every month they say they will have their liquor license sorted out "next month." They also, bafflingly, have run out of sporks more than once and continue to serve food which requires utensils. Disappointing, even by Taco Bell standards.
author: Irina P.

description: Bad bad, they don't put meat on beefy 5 layer burritos. Asked for extra sauce and black short fat chick gave me small handful. Looked like she shook some off her hand before she handed them to me....
author: Luis S.

description: I ordered a crunch wrap supreme and paid extra to add guacamole. I watched the employee make my food and it happened that there was almost no guacamole left in the container. Despite the fact that I watched him, he proceeded to add very little into my crunch wrap because he was too lazy to refill the container and give me the fair amount.  After receiving my crunch wrap I examined my food and found no traces of guac.  The employee was rude when I asked to put more guac (even though I paid for it) and stated she already added it.  Thats not even the worst part. On top of that it took 30 minutes to get my order. It doesn't feel like they value the customers at this location.  Strongly discourage people from going to this taco Bell location.  Don't be decieved by the fancy monitors that the menu is displayed on.  It is not indictive of good service or good quality food. I've been here multiple times and every time they've been out of key ingredients (this time it was cheese and two of the soft drinks)
author: Simon S.

description:
I used this location to order a huge amount of food for my company (through Postmates) and everything was great!!

I called the store the day before to make sure that my large order could be doable and what time I should place the order through Postmates, and Joga answered the phone each time and was honestly the best. He knew exactly what time I should place it, asked me what I was going to order, let me know what items wouldn't be available and how to make things vegan if needed. 

He also told me to call him when I placed the order that day, I did and he told me how he was going to coordinate things so the food would get to me on time and still warm.

To top it off, I realized they forgot part of my order and Joga actually came after the Postmates dude left and brought the rest of it personally!

Everything was super seamless and I know huge orders can be weird but everything was handled perfectly - everyone loved it and the food went FAST.

I'll totally order here again if I need to! Thanks Joga!!
author: Lindsey S.

description:
Hahahaha oh Taco Bell. How cute.

I'm pretty sure this place has the exact same menu as a typical Taco Bell with only a few extra items added and a small mark up for the location and "ambience".

It's a small restaurant with a few flat screen TVs showing non-stop sports. The tables/seats are often dirty with some crumbs, so always remember to get a few extra napkins to wipe it off yourself.

Food-wise, typical Taco Bell food. I found no difference in level of freshness and quality (or lack thereof?). And of course, the tastiness of Taco Bell is solely dependent on your level of inebriation and desperation.

I won't deny that this place is a guilty pleasure of mine. The Doritos Locos Tacos are always both disgusting and delightfully indulgent--one of our great inventions.
author: Yan F.

description:
After the big hullaballo about the Taco Bell Cantina and the promises of margaritas and other alcoholic beverages, this is just a Taco Bell! Albeit, it's a newer and nicer Taco Bell but the menu items are generally the same as you would have at any other Taco Bell (we were having a tough time spotting the unique menu items). 

They're working on their liquor permit so hopefully that comes through soon!
author: Wendy L.

description: Weak!!! Everything is under filled and they don't clean. This place is gross!!!! Saddest tacos and burritos I've ever seen.
author: Isaac K.

description:
dunDUN dunDUN dunDUN dundundun
d dun d d DUNdun
dunDUN dunDUN dunDUN dundundun
d dun d d DUN

Did you know?
I made the brekessel run in 12 tacosecs.
Even though tacosecs is distance:
The distance of my 3 Biscuit Tacos
And Iced Tea laid side by side plus
The distance from them to my mouth.

Even though doritos tacos,
I only care about the breakfast menu.
May prove to be an evil place since
It's on the very same block as my gym.

Gus Fring was here on my 1st visit
But not since - must be busy golfing, or...
author: Dan B.

description:
Three words: Hipster Taco Bell. 

I was intrigued when I heard that there's a new Taco Bell on block and it's badder and fancier than any other. Sure, the space is much nicer than any other Taco Bells (or fast food joint) that I've ever been to, but the menu is the same standard one. I didn't see any alcohol on the menu, but I heard buzz that it's served only after a certain hour or coming soon? 

The pricing seems to be the same as other TB, but then I haven't been to a TB for some time. Of course, it felt like a cheap meal since my baseline is off of lunching in SOMA. They had a sign to download and order through their app to "skip the line", but be warned, the prices are slightly higher through the app!

Over all, the experience is very a-ok. I did appreciate the attendant by the trash cans though, it's always a stressful task trying to sort out my trash, recyclables and composts.
author: Tiffany U.

description: Flies, sticky tables, condiments section that is out of sauce packets and napkins, and non English speaking cooks who aren't able to call out your number. You might go here because Taco Bell is familiar to you, but this one has fallen so below the standard it attempted to set when it became "the Cantina" that you'll feel bad about eating here.
author: Ambrose W.

description:
Came here about a week after opening to see if it lived up to the hype, and I have to say I was very impressed. I'm not embarrassed to admit I've always been a big Taco Bell fan, so I was really excited to hear about the new Cantina concept locations.

As of September 28 they don't serve alcohol, but I hear this will be coming within the next month or so. However I did try the food, which for the most part is the same menu as regular Taco Bells, but with an added Tapas section full of new starters. A friend and I decided to split a few items: the Chicken Quesarito, Homestyle Nachos, and the Loaded Potato Griller. I'm not a very picky person and I usually like whatever I get from Taco Bell, but I will admit everything we ordered tasted about 10x better than any other Taco Bell I've tried. Everything was fresh, made to order, and delicious! 

I'm so glad they chose SF as one of the first Cantina locations. The interior is really modern and hip, and had a sort of Chipotle vibe to it, although it's arguably a lot cooler, with big screen TVs and all. I was surprised to see that there wasn't much seating inside as I can picture it getting pretty busy as it becomes more and more popular.

Overall I had a great time trying it out and will definitely be back again. Highly recommend trying it even if you think you're not a Taco Bell fan!
author: Jaymie S.

description:
I've ordered Mexican Pizzas since I was a kid. Back when they used to put green onions on it !

They serve their Mexican pizza in a nachos container ! WTF ?! My Mexican pizza was crunched into little pieces, I had to eat it with a fork.

When I talked to manager, he said "That's the way we do it here, and it wont change"
author: Sonny S.

description:
The worst employees in all of San Francisco. 

I have been to this location 3 times and each time I have been told I'd need to wait 10 minutes to order because they had "too many orders". 

This is one of the most densely populated parts of San Francisco, perhaps you should have more than three people working?

NO ONE GOES TO TACO BELL TO WAIT 10 MINUTES TO ORDER THEIR FOOD. FIRE THESE LAZY LAZY EMPLOYEES
author: Matt A.

description: Good luck getting food here. They always have someone calling in a 200 taco order at lunch time and then you get a 30 minute wait to get your food.
author: Healy J.

description: This is awful it is dirty and the employees are not very nice at all they act like you are bothering them my daughter had to use the restroom so we didn't hear our order called when I went to the window I didn't just want to grab the bag and dig through in case it wasn't mine so I had to try to get one of the ladies to see if it was mine she didn't even look inside she just nodded and walked off she was right it was mine but I was annoyed because there was no number on it so how was I supposed to know never going here again
author: Dawn A.

description:
It's open late and it's Taco Bell.

After a late night out, it will do the trick.
author: Leana L.

description:
So excited to have a Taco Bell right by me now. I went here yesterday for a little midday snack for the first time and must have been greeted by 5 different employees welcoming me and explaining how everything works. I thought this was a little funny just because it's Taco Bell and I'm pretty sure everyone has been to TB but everyone was extremely friendly. I was one of the only customers in there at the time. 

I ordered a mini beef quesadilla which was the perfect little snack, and it was only $1! What a world we live in.This TB location may be a bit dangerous seeing as i live right by here but definitely not complaining. The space is really nice too! Can't wait for the alcohol addition so i can get a marg with my taco next time :)
author: Ilana B.

description:
This place is awful. Terrible food in a cold shell. I think the low point in my life is reviewing a Taco Bell on yelp, but this place takes so long to get the food out that it might as well be a sit down restaurant. 

The clientele is dicey, the employees don't care, the service sucks. What more is there to say? Might as well stick to my diet...
author: Jay D.

description:
This is a specific shout out to Ashley. 

I work close by and come here every now and then. I had a bad experience on an extremely busy day where I had to wait about a half hour for my food and then a little longer because of some customer-employee interactions. I had a long day, got upset and asked for my food, it was made, life goes on.

Some time later I came back, I ordered some food, and Ashley remembered the experience. She went out of her way to apologize and make it right. This is a couple months later. I couldn't believe it. With the location she's in and the volume she deals with I just couldn't comprehend that she still remembered me. She apologized for the experience and made it right. It was inspiring. 

The reason I wrote this review is to show that sometimes good people have bad days. Come here. Support these people.
author: Brent W.

description:
Taco Bell is my guilty pleasure so I practically fainted when I saw this new concept open up in my hood.

Yup, 5 star fast food experience. Beautiful space (apparently only the 2nd of its kind) with TV's and high tech screens. Touches of SF hipster to boot: clean and sleek interior, hot sauces housed amidst exposed brick, the open-air kitchen...yes, you heard right, now you can see those gorgeous tacos and gorditas made right in front of your very eyes.

But what really calls for a review is the customer service. I swear the entire staff is genuinely happy. Smiles, warm greetings, one guy held the door open for me, another personally handed me my food. Is this real life?

No alcohol yet but same standard menu with a few bonus additions. Prices are 1.5x surge what you'd usually pay at any other Taco Bell but hey, you pay for the experience, right?
author: Jen E.

description:
A Taco Bell I feel safe at.

When I think of Taco Bell, I can only recall stories of crime at the local Taco Bell back home. Crave as I may, I couldn't go back for my own safety.

Taco Bell Cantina was a breath of fresh air. Imagine walking into a nice hipster looking place and getting food like Taco Bell. What more can you ask for?

Taco Bell Cantina features the same menu you know and love from the national chain, and bumps it up a notch in terms of classiness. After you order, feel free to take a seat: they will bring your orders to you. How great is that?

As a deviation from the usual Taco Bells, they also serve some more traditional bar snacks like chicken tenders and mini, classier versions of their Mexican options.

Apparently, they're also planning to get an alcohol license soon. This place will be the poppin' place for Happy Hour on the way to Caltrain.

TIP: Everything tastes good.
author: Brian L.

description: First time at this Taco Bell Cantina. We've been waiting 30 minutes for our food. Unacceptable for a fast food restaurant.
author: Scott M.

description: Just came 11:29pm Sunday and they were closed. Sign on door says midnight close. Online says midnight. Huge waste of time
author: Quags M.

description: Service at night was absolutely terrible. Waited 10 minutes before anyone came over to take my order. The three people working seemed to just be arguing with each other and didn't pay any attention. Once they took the order it took around another 10 minutes to get the food. The lady seemed to be making orders for 4-5 different people, setting them to the side, and then distributing them all together. I saw several other groups leave after not being served. Taco Bell should seriously reconsider the staff here.
author: Michael S.

description:
If I could give this place half a star I would.
