I just left VERY UPSET after waiting 30 mins for my order to come only to realize that after waiting for that long (I assumed that they had a lot of orders from customer) I asked where my number went on the screen. They looked up at the screen and said that they don't know where my order went or they probably made it already. SERIOUSLY? An order doesn't just disappear from the screen. They made our order and shrugged an "I'm sorry" response. 

Later on, I realize that one of the preparers saw their friends and handed them a "bag" not implying anything but you can assume what could be in there. 

DO NOT GO HERE unless you like waiting for your food to arrive like you're at a 4 star restaurant.
author: Charmaine Marie L.

description:
The first Taco Bell Cantina is diagonally across the corner from my office.  I had to try it, so I went in at 8pm in the middle of a baseball game, a few days after opening.  Kind of like the eye of the hurricane for a restaurant a block from AT&T Park.

Overall impression: nice environment.  Normal to slightly-improved Taco Bell food, at least right now (a regular Taco Bell near my house was great for a month after re-opening, too, but then backslid.).  Nothing really unexpected (apparently a liquor license is coming, with bottled beer at least), but pretty good.

I got take-out chicken tenders (same as anywhere), steak soft taco supreme (the tortillas tasted a bit different ... maybe more dry?  fresher?  and the steak was particularly good looking), and a steak quesadilla (also fine).  The store itself is nice -- wood, brick, etc.  Take-out, though, because in SF and especially SoMA, even nice places end up filled with homeless people.  (Was fun seeing 6 Yum! execs standing in the doorway after what appeared to be a homeless person was kicked out.  Check out the McDonald's across the street for what this place will be like in a month or two...)

I'd still prefer a Chipotle based on menu (burrito bowl...), but otherwise, this was fine.  If it were anywhere else, I'd be excited, and if high-rent location Taco Bells reflag as Taco Bell Cantinas, it would overall be a good change.
author: Ryan L.

description:
This place has serious attitude issue, especially during the morning service. Walked up to counter to order meal, the guy gave me a soda cup then I said, "oh I'd like a coffee please." Instead of changing the order he said, "you touched the cup." What kind of attitude is that? And who's fault is it if you didn't even asked me what I want to drink and assumed I want a soda? How rude!  I left.

On other occurrence I have to wait for at least 5 minutes for someone to come to the counter to order.
author: Gary T.

description: This Taco Bell is a huge disappointment. It is the flagship store for San Francisco and is a "Cantina", meaning they serve fresher ingredients and supposedly have a liquor license. They are strategically placed near the ballpark for maximum traffic and visibility and stay open until midnight... we'll they advertise that they are open until midnight and the hours on the door read open 'til midnight, but the manager there, Ashley (sp?), decided that because there were only 3 people working that night that they would close 45 minutes early. When I arrived, there were 3 other people standing outside trying to get in and two more passed me on the way up to frustratedly spew that they were closed. Not only did I take the time to visit that location, many others did as well and it is both disrespectful to their and portrays a bad image on Taco Bell.
author: Josh K.

description:
Taco Bell is supposed to be 1.quick, 2.cheap, and 3.filling. Cantina is none of these compared to other Taco Bells.

1. Slow: It takes a long time to get a small order, even with no other customers around. I do not understand how a staff of three can take 6-8 min for a small two-item order, when other Taco Bells with two sleepy workers can have 3 meals ready for you at 2AM in the same amount of time via drive-thru window. If freshly prepared ingredients made a difference, I'd understand. But the taste and diarrhea is just the same as any other Taco Bell.

2. Overpriced. I get it, Cantina is in a prime location, wages are high, etc...

But $16.00 for a 12-Pack of tacos? $18.00 with tax? with a 10 min wait on top of that?

 That's a hell of a markup! I'd understand if I at least get the same kind of tacos as I do at other franchises, but I don't, which leads to my last point...

3. Skimpy. Normally, 3-4 Soft Tacos would get me full. Not from here. It takes me about 5-6 Soft Tacos from here to get full. It does not make sense to me how I can go to Chipotle and feel full of meat, rice, and salsa for a slightly less cost than it does to buy food here to feel full of starches. 

I want to give this place more stars, I really do...and I know rent and labor is expensive in the city, particularly near AT&T Park...

 But if you can't be a cheap Taco Bell, the workers should at least hustle up instead of taking their sweet time, and give the same proportions as the other franchises...not less...

All in all, a general disappointment, but nothing that cannot be improved on. I am hoping for the latter...
author: geno m.

description:
I love Taco Bell and this new location is the best! 

Inside of it is extremely clean unlike any other Taco Bell I have ever visited. 

Food is the same but served kind of restaurant style. Very clean! 

Parking on the street is easy.

They have TV screens for sports!
author: Hiral P.

description:
This is one of the best Taco Bell's I've ever been at! It's a "Taco Bell Cantina," which means it's supposed to serve alcohol, but they're still working on getting their liquor license. The girl at the cash register said that some people come in and ask if they've gotten their license yet, and when she has to tell them "not yet" they turn around and leave. Guess everyone around here is super ready for that license to come through!

This Taco Bell Cantina definitely sets itself apart from all other Taco Bell's in that it has a completely different look and feel on the inside, everything from new seating to digital menu boards. Besides the regular menu options, they also have "shareable" items which really intrigued my friend and I when we stopped by on our trip to SF. We ended up sharing the quesadilla nachos (I think that's the name... in the shareable section) and it came out beautifully. It's nice that you can actually see the food being made right in front of you, like at Chipotle or Subway.

There was three dollops of guac, sour cream, and salsa (respectively) on top of the little quesadilla pieces which made it amazing.

I would definitely come back to this Taco Bell, especially when it has alcohol :p
author: Richa A.

description:
I LOVE Taco Bell (fine, go ahead and judge me) and I was so excited when I this opened right around the corner from my apartment. Unlike the Taco Bell I grew up with, this Cantina location is actually cute! And the prices are amazingly more or less the same. Get the app - you can order ahead and show up at the window.. AND as if it wasn't cheap enough to begin with, the app almost always has discounts.

The cherry on top? The service is always so friendly!! What's there not to love?
author: Gowri R.

description: They lied! Straight up - came here to eat at 11:50 and went to door and window and they turned me away! Do not allow this place a liquor license - they lie already and will keep it up!
author: Tamas G.

description:
I don't feel like I should even consider this as a Taco Bell. The food is tastier and freshly made. The apple empanada is not dry at all... it's very creamy and potent.

I do not like Taco Bell... but this Taco Bell Cantina one made me change my mind.

There's hope for humanity yet.
author: Dominique S.

description:
This Taco Bell is normally great - clean, nice location, food is the usual.

However, evening of Friday 11/4, there is an employee standing at the door around 11:40pm denying customers entry saying it's closed. The posted hours are midnight everyday. Strange. Hopefully the manager reads these and corrects the issue.
author: Jonathan B.

description: My wife birthed our baby here and the staff was real cool about it. We named him taco.
author: Tristan E.

description: What a dump!   At times no cash in the drawer and only accept credit; rarely have large cups; and my all time favorite using ketchup in place of salsa because they are out.  Oh, and let's not even talk about how filthy it is
author: Marc D.

description: I never thought the Taco Bell experience could get any better, but I was wrong. I love the modern look, and I hope to see one in South Bay soon! As of 10/31 they weren't serving alcohol yet, but the day they do, I'll be on the next caltrain up
author: Megha M.

description:
Taco Bell, but a bit fancier. You can't go wrong with Taco Bell--I mean I guess you can, but the when the craving hits, this isn't a bad place to go. It makes you feel less crappy about your decision about giving into your fast food cravings. :P

Went here after the Color Run 2015. The food is standard, which is expected, and in a way great, cause the prices are the same as any other Taco Bell. The atmosphere was cool--big screen TV, more hipster seating. It had a sort of Chipotle vibe. What was nice was that the staff asked for your name. It made it a bit more personalized vs just being any old number. :) It was too early to actually try any booze from here though, but hey, I would totes come back to check it out! Thanks Taco Bell, until next time!
author: Mariel A.

description: This is the nicest Taco Bell that I have ever been to and it was open late! The guy who took our order was very nice and answered my silly questions so that's a plus. I only came in for the chips and nacho cheese, I love that fake cheese... its the best thing ever like movie theatre status but way cheaper!
author: Jenny E.

description:
I've been to this taco bell three times in the past three days. It is honestly the best taco bell I have ever been to and I have been to a ton of taco bells. The staff is extremely friendly, helpful, and nice. I even had a worker offer to clean my table and take my trash. 

Things that stand out from a regular taco bell:
Massive projector that plays sports
Chicken tenders and other items not typically on taco bell menus
Cleanliness
Patio seating
Food that looks like the picture on the menu

If you like taco bell and/or cheap Mexican food, make sure to check this place out.
author: Vac C.

description:
Move along, nothing to see here ...

As a new concept restaurant for Taco Bell, I would have expected that a completely different look and feel would have been introduced.  Instead, the overused reclaimed wood, industrial metal furniture look that was popular 10 years ago dominates this space, which took over The Melt sandwich restaurant.  I don't know "cantina" decor constitutes, but I suspect that the same look that Starbucks is using for their "upscale" line of coffee shops, is not cantina chic.

The menu items appear very similar to other Taco Bell restaurants.  Outside of the reported beer sales, which have yet to take place, there's not much different between this and a regular Taco Bell outlet.  The sale of beer, in itself, does not make for a more interesting dining experience ... more authentic Mexican food, on the other hand, would.
author: Rafael R.

description:
Let it be known, I love Taco Bell.

This is the best Taco Bell location I have ever been to. Fresh ingredients (save your sassy comments, they will be wasted on this devoted Taco Bell lover), an incredibly clean environment, and waiters that not only deliver your order to you, but also take your trash from you. 

Hurrah!!!
author: Yanni L.

description: This Taco Bell clearly broke the rules and closed before their posted closing time and the manager should be fired.
author: P T.

description:
Nice addition to the neighborhood for cheap eats, but the meat in the tacos is 1/2 the amount of any other Taco Bell.  And the cheese in the Quesalupa was a little disappointing. 

It's a pity....
author: Jon H.

description: I'm a huge taco bell fan but let's be honest, it's really just a place to grab a quick bite and resume your schedule. In that sense I'm giving this place 4 stars as it's cosmetically more appealing but the food is still what you would expect(which is really all you can ask for at a fast food chain). The menu is more or less the same as other taco bells but this place is cleaner and has a better ambiance with the "Cantina" style feel. Unfortunately, this was not that new concept where alcohol was served. They also have big screen TVs to watch while eating which is a plus. I would prefer this location over other taco bells but in the end other than the looks and the TVs, it's really all the same if you're looking for a quick bite.
author: James K.

description: It's great until you don't get your +1 taco when ordering meals, like I've experienced for the last 3 times.
author: Cody R.

description:
This is what every Taco Bell experience should be. 

@TacoBell: you should really check in with your other franchises in the city. They are hurting your brand.
author: Adam S.

description: I can't believe I convinced myself to eat at Taco Bell after so many 15plus years in hiatus... What was I thinking?  This place is the ultimate in disgusting. It barely even qualifies as food fit for human consumption... To add insult to injury, it's not cheap.  Everything Taco Bell does with their 'food' is a product of cutting corners and minimizing quality.  Fake cheese, very little fake meat on the burrito, fake guacamole, the tacos completely break apart after one bite because they are so thin ... Cheap cheap cheap food that is way overpriced for what you get which is heartburn. Avoid like the plague.
author: G B.

description: Understaffed, slow and rude. Every time i go here it takes at least 20 to 30 min to get your order. Many times one person would work at the register and preparing your food at the same time.
author: Dan D.

description:
My first Taco Bell meal in 10 years .. Good. Half the price I paid at the iron cactus or 1/3 of tres next door
I'll come back!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
This has to be the best Taco Bell in existence.

A few notes about this review: I haven't tried any of the shared plates, and AFAIK this location doesn't have its liquor license yet.

So if I haven't tried the things that ostensibly differentiate this from a regular ol' Taco Bell, why do I like it so much? Simple: Much more care is being put into all aspects of the experience, from the food and atmosphere to the service (not a word typically associated with fast food locations).

The food is prepared much more carefully. Every menu item is pretty much hitting its Platonic ideal. For example, the shell part of a Mexican Pizza has a crunchy, flaky texture. Everything is heated evenly. The service is great, with smiling staff that will offer to clear your table.

There's really not much more you can ask for from a Taco Bell.

That being said, there are a few ways it could be improved:
* Seating seems too limited for peak hours. I haven't seen them set up the outdoor seating recently; this might be the infamous Beacon HOA causing trouble.
* The packaging used in this restaurant is non-standard. They use these compostable-looking bowls, but the shapes seem kind of wrong. Anything that's roughly square or circular (Mexican Pizzas, Crunchwraps) doesn't really fit right.
* The differences in food preparation aren't always perfect. The shell of the Doritos Locos Tacos are perhaps *too* crunchy--every single one I've eaten has fallen to pieces halfway through.
* The tabletops could be better. They're going for an industrial look with brick and timber, but they're using plywood tables where you would typically see walnut or steel.
author: Michael C.

description: The food is good, the place is clean, I mean it is new.  The staff is really friendly.  They are still figuring out the app on your phone, I have used it, and it sort of confuses the staff, so be patient.  At lunch time, when the place is packed, this is the way to go
author: Paul G.

description:
I mean, its still a Taco Bell. That being said, its by far the best Taco Bell I have ever been to. Extremely fast, consistent and nice decor. If you are ever in the mood for Taco Bell, you have to try this spot! 

They also have some unique items. I was expecting them to taste somewhat un-Taco Bell like but its still is has the same flavor. My tip would be to skip these items and just stick to the basics.
author: Farnaz K.

description: As expected, double decker was sublime. Hot sauce on point except they've eliminated verde. VERde bad decision. They no longer carry cinnamon twists which was a disappointment so terrible it ruined the entire experience. 3/5 would return with knowledge enough to go to Marlowe for dessert.
author: Laura E.

description:
Pretty normal Taco Bell, with some fancy TV's on the wall.  They managed to not mess up my six person order, which was sort of surprising.  When I went, they unfortunately did not serve alcohol at the time.  I had some normal Taco Bell fare which was on point, and also tried the shareable taquitos (yum!) and the quesadilla nachos.  Cutting a quesadilla into triangles doesn't suddenly turn it into nachos -- it's a shareable quesadilla.  Oh well, it was still delicious.

The actual physical location is pretty small -- I was expecting something similar to Uno Dos in terms of size.  This was like a small fast-food location.  It felt sort of cramped & the layout is sort of odd.

I'll definitely be back since it's one of the few (full) Taco Bell locations near downtown, and it'll probably be a solid spot to get some TBell & beers before Giants games.
author: Chris S.

description: Super bummed that they opened this so near my work because now I am going to be eating here too much. I'm actually more of a Dell Taco guy as I find a lot of the taco bells make quick and sloppy food. However, I was pleased that they are trying a new format with this location. Slightly more expensive, more attention to detail and beer!  There's only one other place in the USA where a Taco Bell Cantina exists, in Chicago, so this is unique. Only issue is the city of SF has decided not to give these guys their beer license which I have to say is extremely lame given how many other half-assed places in SF serve beer. Anyhow I am sure they will figure it out. Best bet it the bean and cheese burrito with green sauce, grilled.
author: Brian J.

description: Taco Bell location before getting on Megabus and heading back to Los Angeles and it was an overall great experience. They have Wi-Fi and very clean bathroom and a very nice setup to sit and watch TV while you eat. They took my order and it came out promptly, and I was engaged by the staff the entire time. Probably was the best TB I have been to in a while
author: Khalil J.

description: I had a bad experience coming to this particular Taco Bell. It took over 20 minutes for them to make my order of 2 tacos and a burrito to go. Two of the employees starting arguing and fighting with one another right in front of all the customers, and one of them walked right out. This was very unprofessional and I doubt that I'll return anytime soon. This Taco Bell needs to greatly improve their organization and management.
author: Diana F.

description: The best Taco Bell I've ever went to, great customer service, the staff are nice here, better quality of food. They're clean compare to the other a taco bells in town.
author: Braddah Rick M.

description: This place just opened up right below where I live so I decided to check it out. Food is good (I ordered chicken tacos). Normally I don't write reviews for fast food chains, but the service here was stellar! The workers were super friendly and cheerful. I was welcomed on the way in, and on the way out I was asked how everything was. I'll definitely be coming by more often. :)
author: Sophia H.

description: Seriously? Took 15 minutes to get our order of 3 items. S Wang by because we were in a rush, may as well had good food somewhere else and waited the same.
author: H E.

description: It is Taco Bell nirvana. It's fancy and clean and full of smiling, helpful Taco Bell associates. I refilled my stomach with an old school tostada, pintos 'n cheese and a lettuce-filled 7-Layer Burrito. Whilst enjoying my early dinner, I enjoyed my street level view of Townsend Street. The walking pouch of Taco Bell Mild Sauce made for a mildly amusing mascot. I took the opportunity to recharge my iPhone, as well. Overall, a perfect TBC experience. Next time, I think that I'll try out the Live Mas app.
author: T Shane G.

description: Received the world's smallest 7-layer burrito. They forgot the guacamole, and I didn't get the chipotle sauce I paid extra for. I won't be back.
author: Holly R.

description: Wow. I came to this Bell because I read that they served alcohol. I'm dismayed to report that was a lie and they don't yet have a liquor license. I will consider changing my review when I can drink a glass of fine wine or premium twisted freeze with my processed garbage. One star....for now....
author: Nic C.

description: Finally a Taco Bell in my hood. Really nice new concept. Food is delicious as always. Pack your back McDonald's!
author: Hanna S.

description: Rad Taco Bell, they have like 3-4 kinds of Mountain Dew!  Great flat screens for Warriors/Giants games.  Would be nice if they had more seating.
author: Mike J.

description: It's exactly what Taco Bell was meant to be. The whole restaurant is essentially a cross between Taco Bell food and Chipotle restaurant style (I mean the physically) plus large TVs and alcoholic beverages.
author: Tristan S.

description: Update your hours otherwise people like me will show up when it's closed, or at least provide a phone number bros
author: Sam A.

description: They gave me a taco with everything outside the shell, clearly a mistake while trying to work with a crowd, but treated me like I was rude when I asked politely and patiently for a new one properly made. I thought this was supposed to be a fancy, upper class Taco Bell. Rude staff, poorer quality than a regular Taco Bell. Bad job all around.
author: Mitchell T.

description: Foods above par for a Taco Bell. But they're sooooo slowwwwww.  Takes 20 minutes to get ur food sometimes.  I come here cuz it's open late and it's right next to my house.
author: David S.

description: The reviews on here are fake don't be fooled. There are so many other options in this neighborhood to enjoy. There is a real Mexican food restaurant on4th and Townsend food is worth paying for, they make sure your order is correct they understand customer service and they have a liquor license. I don't see this Taco Bell lasting too long in this neighborhood seems like a bad idea, nobody eats fast food anymore. They hire violent employees that beat up customers. The managers only told me sorry and offered to call the police that was it. It's my duty to let all Taco Bell customers aware of this location.
author: Adrian C.

description: Nicest tbell I've been too. Great addition to the dearth of fast food joints in soma. I use the app to order ahead of time and pick it up from the window.
author: Joseph K.

description:
All I had to do was poke my head in the door to confirm the obvious: it's just a Taco Bell with some wood accents. Basically the same food. No booze as of yet.

The numerous 4-5 star reviews are probably posts that the T-Bell marketing team paid to have written. Or to put it another way: fake.

You can walk less than a block in ANY direction down here and find a better lunch option. Again, it's just Taco Bell.
author: robert h.

description: It's Taco Bell with a walk up window. Heard they were trying to get booze here, which would be pretty cool. I'll be back when they do!
author: Andrew P.

description: This Taco Bell is sooo amazing, big tv and the food tastes way better then any Taco Bell i ever had. I made small talk with the employees which were very nice! Love this Taco Bell would come again!
author: Kayla K.

description: So good it's bad for me. The experience getting food here even during a Giants game left a smile on my face walking out the door. Really clean inside, and the people working seem to really care about whether you are happy or not. Not kid isn't but they were nice. Smiley greeter by the door telling people to have a good night and Coke back soon made my day haha definitely not a regular Taco Bell. This place might just re ignite my high school self in me.
author: Kelvin T.

description: Five stars for a Taco Bell?  Well, yes, comparing against all other Taco Bells, this one certainly deserves five stars.  It's probably the prettiest Taco Bell you've ever seen, and I love the flat screen tvs that were showing the game.  Service was very friendly and prompt, and the food was reliable Taco Bell fare.  It was really clean inside, too.  It's only been open for a matter of days, so I hope it maintains as time goes on, but this was probably the best Taco Bell experience ever.  And once they get their beer license, even better!
author: Michelle C.

description: Best Taco Bell I've ever had. The chicken tenders are amazing, I was definitely surprised. Didn't expect Taco Bell to have good tenders
author: Bre E.

description: I walked by frequently but never went in until today. It looks like a hip, fancy taqueria, but the menu is really just like a regular Taco Bell. I had a $2 burrito and enjoyed the NBA game showing on the flat screen TVs. This is a hidden gem in a neighborhood where $10 sandwiches is the norm.
author: Fai C.

description: Taco Bell + a friendly wait staff that doesn't hate you!  Amazing.  They even added chicken tenders to the menu.
author: Omar S.

description: Opened a couple days ago. They have the usual Taco Bell fare plus some sharable snacks in a basket. Slushy drinks are available now but they are still working on their liquor license. Employees say it'll be about another month. Can't wait! There's also a mobile ordering window that will come in handy later. Nice, more affordable addition to the neighborhood.
author: Nina L.

description: well this just opened across the street from my work, and being from the midwest where fast food is plentiful, i'm happy with this addition when I need a quick fix. Looks very nice inside, and the staff was all very friendly, however it's only day two, so hopefully it can stay that way.
author: Andy H.

description:
Don't be fooled - this is just a regular Taco Bell with the same old menu, but enhanced with a big screen TV and some other minor upgrades that purportedly make it a "cantina."  Want to have delusions of grandeur while eating unhealthy food?  Then come to this place!

It gets 3 stars instead of 2 only because I happen to like Taco Bell generally.  The people who have given it 5 stars are either ringers or need to do a serious examination of their lives.  Some of their comments are embarrassing.  Have you never seen a Taco Bell before?

(One good thing to come out of this charade is that it might force the McDonald's across the street, which is among the dingiest in the country, to clean up its act.)
author: Bret L.

description: Great new look and decent food. The food is served right to your table which is nice and there were big screens to watch the game. We'll be back!
author: Guy V.

description: Slowest Taco Bell of all the land. It does not take 40 minutes to make anything on the menu; let's be real.
author: Pamela S.

description: Love the big screen TV. Bathroom was free of odor. Keep it up, Taco Bell!
author: S S.
